result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 2:52 PM Defendant Scott Patrick Myers in court.  Attorney Alexis C Raihle in court for Scott Patrick Myers.  Attorney Joseph M. Schieffer in court for State of Wisconsin.  21CF95, 21CM110 and 22CF78. ADA Schieffer: guilty to Ct#2 in 21CF95 and Ct#1 in 21CM110- 2 years probation; concurrent; 90 days jail, Maintain Absolute Sobriety. No Contact with AMM except as allowed in the family court order in case 21FA95,No Violent or Abusive Contact with CHH, Not to enter any bars, taverns or liquor stores where alcohol is the primary sales/service, court costs ($543) Ct#1 and Ct#3 in 21CF95, Ct#2-3 in 21CM110 and 22cf78 dismiss/read in. Atty Raihle and Def agree.Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, penalties and constitutional rights  Defendant pleas guilty to Ct#2 in 21CF95 and Ct#1 in 21CM110.Counsel stipulates to factual basis for plea. Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds Defendant is freely, voluntarily and knowingly making plea and waiving constitutional rights. Court finds Defendant guilty to Ct#2 in 21CF95 and Ct#1 in 21CM110. Court dismisses/reads in  Ct#1 and Ct#3 in 21CF95, Ct#2-3 in 21CM110 and 22CF78. Court orders S/W 2 years probation on Ct#2 in 21CF95 and Ct#1 in 21CM110; concurrent- court costs on each case ($543), Maintain Absolute Sobriety. Not to enter any bars, taverns or liquor stores where alcohol is the primary sales/service. No contact with AMM except as allowed in the family case 21FA95, Provide DNA sample within 30 days. Comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections. No Violent or Abusive Contact with CH. 60 days jail, stayed - to be used at the agent's discretion. Appeal rights are given to the defendant. Defendant to report to probation today. the cash bond on 21CM110 and 22cf78 to apply to court costs. 0 days credit. 3:18
CVH

Plea hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

9:58 AM Defendant Scott Patrick Myers appears in Court, Atty Alexis C Raihle, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer appears for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF78 (PH), 22CF78 and 21CM110 (STC). Sgt. Zachary Thurber.  S/T. ADA Schieffer questions Sgt. Thurber. Record reflects identification of DE. Cross Atty Raihle. ADA Schieffer is requesting the Court find probable cause and bind DE over on 22CF78, Atty Raihle argues.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DE probably committed a felony. Court binds DE over for further proceedings.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

3:22 PM Defendant Scott Patrick Myers appears in custody from Jail via video,  Atty Derek Sanders appears by phone, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer appears for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF78, 21CF95 and 21CM110 following for scheduling purposes. Court reserves DE's rights. Court reviews DE's rights. Court confirms address. Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waives reading. ADA Schieffer asks to take notice of the underlying cases. ADA Schieffer is requesting a $2,500.00 CB w/conditions of AS & NC CVH, MLD and MRD, their residence and not to possess firearms and NTE, DE has no objection. Court will order as requested w/the exception of his work. Court adjourned at 3:41 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 08:45 am.
